Episodes.Title: I Lied, Too
Episodes.Plot: Fresh off her legal victory over billionaire CEO Arthur Frobisher, Patty is taking a break from the law and pouring her energies into her new charitable foundation. But when Patty receives a call from Daniel Purcell, a man from her past, she finds herself entangled in a case with personal and professional repercussions, the likes of which she could never have imagined.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,offensive language,drug use and sexual references
Episodes.Writer: Todd A. Kessler, Glenn Kessler, Daniel Zelman
Episodes.GuestStars: Tom Aldredge, Zachary Booth, Glen Kessler, Todd A. Kessler, James Naughton, Mario Van Peebles, Steve Belanger, Ann Bradson, Brett Cullen, Alexandra Daddario, Guiesseppe Jones, Debra Lass, Delaney Muro, Dennis Ryan

Episodes.Title: Burn It, Shred It, I Don't Care
Episodes.Plot: Patty suspects there is more to Daniel Purcell's case than simple murder; Ellen secretly assists the FBI in their attempt to flip Tom Shayes and use him against Patty.

Episodes.Title: I Agree, It Wasn't Funny
Episodes.Plot: Patty begins to question Ellen's motives for returning to the firm; Patty tries to stop a corporate merger that she thinks is connected to Christine Purcell's murder.

Episodes.Plot: Convinced that she knows who is responsible for Christine's murder, Patty uses the media to wage war; Ellen gets closer in her attempt to link Frobisher to David's murder.

Episodes.Title: They Had To Tweeze That Out Of My Kidney
Episodes.Plot: As she copes with mounting pressure, Patty begins to unravel Walter Kendrick's energy scheme. Meanwhile, Arthur Frobisher's past will come back to haunt him.

Episodes.Title: Look What I Dug Up This Time
Episodes.Plot: Ellen convinces the FBI to radically change their approach in the investigation. Meanwhile, Daniel Purcell reenters Patty's life and becomes critical to her case against UNR.

Episodes.Title: Trust Me
Episodes.Plot: Patty goes to extremes to win her case against UNR, as Ellen's season long quest for revenge builds to an explosive conclusion.
